alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 2:41PM EST until January 30 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash from a combination of previous precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on partially frozen ground. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...From this evening to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Five Crossings, a local county river park at old U.S. Highway 136 bridge site, begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 19.0 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 545 AM EST /445 AM CST/.
